#Text=Penzance
#Text=Penzance
#Text=( Cornish : Pennsans ) is the most south-westerly town in Cornwall .
#Text=Famous for its association with the Gilbert and Sullivan opera ( now often played as a musical ) The Pirates of Penzance , the town is an ideal base for exploring the Penwith area of Cornwall .
#Text=It is increasingly attracting those interested in cultural tourism due to its long association with the arts .
#Text=Penzance is the main link with the Isles of Scilly via the spring and summer-only ferry .
#Text=By plane
#Text=( NQY ) has flights from London ( Gatwick & Stanstead ) , Dublin , Leeds Bradford , Bristol , Manchester and Cardiff .
#Text=It 's about 30 miles ( 48 km ) away from Penzance by A3075 and A30 , reckon 45 min by car .

#Text=Its two disadvantages are ( i ) most flights are summer only ; ( ii ) public transport is tricky as first you have to get the bus into Newquay ( last bus around 6:30PM ) , then rely on an infrequent bus or branch-line train for connections to Penzance .
#Text=Exeter
#Text=Airport
#Text=( EXT ) is further but may be a simpler option .
#Text=It has more flights year-round , the airport bus runs until 10PM , and mainline trains run hourly from Exeter to Penzance .
#Text=There are flights to the Isles of Scilly from ( LEQ ) at St Just TR19 7RL , 6 miles ( 10 km ) west of Penzance .
#Text=Flights operate year-round M - Sa and in summer are every 30 min ; flight time is just 15 min so day-trips are feasible .

#Text=The " Skybus " aircraft are small fixed-wing twin-props ( e. g. Twin Otter or BNF Islander ) so your total baggage limit is only 15 kg , and flights can be grounded by weather that would n't bother an Airbus or 737 .

column1: #Text=There 's also a helicopter service , using a 10-seater AW169 .

#Text=Adult fare is from £80 each way , day-trip £120 by " Skybus " and from £120 each way , day-trip £220 by helicopter . ( For other transport routes , see Isles of Scilly " Get in " . ) A bus runs hourly between Penzance railway station and the airport to connect with flights : 20 min , £6 each way , book it along with your flight .
#Text=By car follow A30 then B3306 , long-stay parking is available .
#Text=There are plans for a new helipad just outside Penzance , to run helicopters year-round to St Mary 's and Tresco in the Isles of Scilly , including on Sundays .
#Text=This is intended to start service in 2019 but at present is not confirmed .
#Text=By train
#Text=Direct trains run to Penzance from London Paddington ( 8 daily , 5 hours ) , Exeter ( 8 daily , 2 hours ) and Plymouth ( 15 daily , 2 hours ) .
#Text=There are frequent connections to Bristol ( 4 hours ) , Birmingham ( 5 hours ) and the north , with one direct service to Sheffield , York , Newcastle , Edinburgh and Glasgow .
#Text=There is also an overnight sleeper train , The Night Riviera .
#Text=This runs Sunday to Friday from London Paddington around 11:30PM , reaching Penzance by 8AM ( on Su by M 9AM ) .
#Text=The return train leaves Penzance Su - F around 9:30PM to reach Paddington at 5AM ; you can stay aboard until 7AM .
#Text=Book via Great Western ( www.gwr.com ) , with airline seats , or single or double sleeper cabins available .

#Text=Other nearby destinations along the main line , served by hourly trains between Penzance and Plymouth , are St Erth ( for St Ives ) , St Austell ( for Eden Project ) , Par ( for Newquay ) , and Bodmin .
#Text=See National Rail for times and fares ; advance booking is usually much cheaper .
#Text=A Ride Cornwall Ranger is good value for local travel .
#Text=It allows unlimited off-peak travel within Cornwall , and between Cornwall and Plymouth , by all trains and most buses .
#Text=" Off-peak " means M - F after 9AM , and all day Sa Su & holidays .
#Text=An adult day-ticket is £13 , children and concessions around £10 .
#Text=is at the bottom end of town by the bus station , and a short walk from the ferry terminal .
#Text=There 's not much within the station , but cafes and other facilities in town nearby .
#Text=By coach
#Text=National Express coach NX404 runs overnight from London Victoria ( 8 hr ) via Heathrow Airport , Bath , Bristol Airport , Exeter , Torquay and Plymouth .
#Text=NX315 runs daily along the south coast from Eastbourne via Brighton , Portsmouth , Southampton , Eastbourne , Exeter and Plymouth .
#Text=First Kernow bus T1 runs every 30 min between Penzance and Truro ( 1 hr 45 min ) , via St Erth , Hayle , Camborne , and Redruth .
#Text=Change at Truro for Newquay , St Austell and Bodmin .
#Text=Reaching Plymouth and Exeter by bus is not worth the bother , take the train .
#Text=By car
#Text=Penzance is a 5- to 6-hour drive from London via M4 , M5 , and A30 .
#Text=It 's a long way and at some point you 'll need to refuel .
#Text=Do n't be paying motorway prices , there 's supermarket petrol at ( amongst others ) M5 jcn 28 ( Cullompton Tesco ) , A30 Bodmin ( Asda , Launceston Rd Bodmin ) and A30 Penzance ( Tesco ) .
#Text=By boat
#Text=A ferry plies between Penzance and the Isles of Scilly , daily from mid-March to October .
#Text=The ferry ( Scillonian III ) leaves Penzance around 9AM to reach the main island of St Mary 's at noon ; it returns at 4:30PM for 7:15PM .
#Text=Only foot passengers are carried .
#Text=Day-trips allow enough time to visit Tresco , where the Abbey Gardens are the islands ' main draw .
#Text=Booking strongly recommended , and see Isles of Scilly : " Get in " for other ferry practicalities .
#Text=For long-stay parking in Penzance while you visit the islands , check Islesofscilly-travel for options , which include :
#Text=For a day-trip , the Council-run long-stay car parks at the Harbour and St Anthony 's Gardens charge £8 for 24 hours .
#Text=They 're pay & display so you ca n't use them for longer stays .
#Text=IOS Parking and Scilly Parking are two firms offering secure long-stay parking , both near the harbour and off-site with shuttle transfer .
#Text=They 're about £5 per day .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Walking is the best way to get around town in Penzance .
#Text=Newlyn
#Text=, Mousehole and St Michael 's Mount are within hiking distance for healthy adults , but use the bus for those places if there are children , luggage , or dodgy knees or hips involved .
#Text=Take the bus for :
#Text=Land 's End
#Text=:
#Text=bus A1 hourly via Newlyn , Lamorna and Porthcurno , one hour , from 7AM to 6PM .
#Text=St Ives
#Text=:
#Text=bus A2 hourly via Marazion , St Erth and Lelant , 45 min , from 9AM to 10PM .
#Text=These " A"-buses , operated by First Kernow , are blue open-top double-deckers in summer .
#Text=For bus travel plus rail , a good deal is the Ride Cornwall Ranger ( adult £13 ) described above .
#Text=For bus only , buy a Day Rider for £12 ( child £6 ) from the Bus Station or from the driver on boarding - contactless bank cards accepted .
#Text=Bus drivers also issue Ride Cornwall Rangers , but only for full price , go to the station for concessions .
